summary: Email chain between attorney Sigrid McCawley and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling calls and meetings for attorney proffers, and provide detailed allegations from multiple clients/victims regarding sexual abuse by Epstein and Maxwell, including specific incidents, locations, and other potential witnesses.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Attorney, Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing multiple clients who are victims/witnesses in the Epstein investigation. She is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to arrange interviews and proffers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation. Described as having sexually abused multiple women, flown them to his properties, and directed them to obtain passports.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as physically and sexually abusing victims, sometimes in Epstein's presence. Instructed a masseuse to "Give Jeffrey whatever he wants."

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as being witnessed by a victim on one occasion at Epstein's New York mansion, though she never formally met him.

persons.name: Charles Gerald Goldsmith
persons.context: Described by a relator as an acquaintance of Epstein who visited him in Palm Beach jail several times a week. Potential witness.

persons.name: Stan
persons.context: Another attorney who had previously provided a client's contact information to the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: FBI agent (name redacted) handling victim services. Her phone number is provided for victims seeking counseling.

connections.description: Described as jointly involved in the sexual abuse and trafficking of victims. Maxwell allegedly abused victims in Epstein's presence.
McCawley is an attorney representing multiple victims of Epstein, communicating with prosecutors about their allegations.
McCawley's clients allege abuse by Maxwell, and McCawley is facilitating their communication with investigators.
Described as an acquaintance who visited Epstein in jail frequently, potentially acting as a "fixer."
A victim witnessed Prince Andrew at Epstein's New York mansion, indicating a social connection.

events.title: Victim moves out after Maxwell incident
events.description: A victim moved out of Epstein's 66th Street apartment in the summer of 2001 after an incident involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Masseuse flown to New York and assaulted
events.description: A woman was flown to New York by Epstein, gave a massage to Ghislaine Maxwell, was then taken to Epstein's mansion where he grabbed her between her legs against her will.

events.title: Attorney-Government Correspondence
events.description: Series of emails between attorney Sigrid McCawley and an AUSA scheduling calls and discussing victim interviews and attorney proffers related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.context: The AUSA references "the differing trajectory of the investigation since last week," which, given the date (August 2019), strongly implies the recent death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 401 E. Las Olas Blvd. Suite 1200, Fort Lauderdale, FL, 33301 (Boies Schiller Flexner office)
Epstein's apartments on 66th Street, New York
Epstein's home in US Virgin Islands
Ghislaine Maxwell's home (in New York, described in detail by a victim)
New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York office)
keyFacts: A victim alleges she was sexually abused multiple times by Jeffrey Epstein and was also physically/sexually abused by Ghislaine Maxwell with Epstein present.
A victim (a masseuse) alleges that after massaging Ghislaine Maxwell, Maxwell instructed her to "Give Jeffrey whatever he wants." Epstein then assaulted her at his mansion.
A victim witnessed Prince Andrew at Epstein's New York mansion on one occasion.
Attorney Sigrid McCawley references multiple clients with detailed allegations, including one who lived at Epstein's 66th Street apartment and one who was flown to his New Mexico ranch.

The correspondence indicates the investigation's trajectory changed significantly in August 2019, a clear reference to Jeffrey Epstein's death, and the prosecutors are still seeking information from victims.
